subject: RE: [junit] Re: Help plz...
msgSnippet: ... But using comments instead of code isn t free, too. And most often maintenance is much more important than performance. Take care,I lja
messageBody:
Jim Dixon wrote:

>> I myself wouldn't avoid defining a method to make things clear. I
>> might then wind it back in /if and when/ a performance measurement
>> showed it was necessary.
>
> I agree with this entirely. My point is only that there _is_ a cost;
> it's not free.

But using comments instead of code isn't free, too. And most often
maintenance is much more important than performance.

Take care,I lja
